revised_title: Investigating the Gibraltar Current and Physical Researches in the Mediterranean
tldr: The author, Dr. William B. Carpenter, describes his research on the Gibraltar Current and other physical researches conducted in the Mediterranean Sea during a voyage on the Surveying-ship 'Shearwater.' He aimed to investigate the existence of an outward under-current in the Strait of Gibraltar and study the effects of winds and tides on the current's rate and direction. Additionally, he explored the temperature and density of the Eastern Mediterranean's water, the composition of gases at the bottom of the sea, and the fauna in the region.
